docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 26--The Government at 6 o'clock this evening reimposed the state of siege that was lifted on the 6th of last month, and which had been in force since the middle of December 1941.

headline.main: ARGENTINA REVIVES ITS STATE OF SIEGE; EDITORS ARE JAILED; Hundreds of Democrats Fall into Police Net as Wave of Terror Follows Coup SOME FLEE TO EMBASSIES Anti-Axis Papers First to Feel Blow--Regime Calls Move Preliminary to Election

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESI By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 26 (U.P.)--The Uruguayan Cabinet resigned today to give freedom of action to President Juan Jose de Amezaga to reorganize it, granting wider representation to political parties, which would give the Government a larger...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 26 (U.P.)--The Uruguayan Cabinet resigned today to give freedom of action to President Juan Jose de Amezaga to reorganize it, granting wider representation to political parties, which would give the Government a larger congressional backing.
docs.abstract: Cabinet resigns to permit reorganization by Pres de Amezaga

headline.main: ARGENTINE REGIME WIDENS TERRORISM; Many New Arrests Reported-- Prensa, Nacion Heads Seized --U. S. to Review Situation Terrorism Spreads in Argentina; Press Chiefs Among Scores Held Embassies Crowded Stock Exchange Head Seized

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESI By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)-- The State Department disclosed tonight that a general review of United States policy on Argentina was imminent because of recent political developments in that country.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)-- The State Department disclosed tonight that a general review of United States policy on Argentina was imminent because of recent political developments in that country.

docs.snippet: Frederick Carl Weimer, former newspaper man and manufacturer, who served during the second World War as an attache at the American Embassy, Uruguay, died Thursday at the age of 71 in the British Hospital in Montevideo, according to word received here...
docs.lead_paragraph: Frederick Carl Weimer, former newspaper man and manufacturer, who served during the second World War as an attache at the American Embassy, Uruguay, died Thursday at the age of 71 in the British Hospital in Montevideo, according to word received here yesterday by his brother, Joseph Glenn Weimer of Montevideo

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28-- After forty-eight nightmarish hours of terror during which the flower of the Argentine intellectual and business world spent varying periods of time in jail, the persecution of Government opponents decreased suddenly today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28-- After forty-eight nightmarish hours of terror during which the flower of the Argentine intellectual and business world spent varying periods of time in jail, the persecution of Government opponents decreased suddenly today.
docs.abstract: hears from Charge d'Affaires Cabot of reaction to repressions

headline.main: ARRESTS SLACKEN IN BUENOS AIRES; VIOLENCE FLARES IN CANADIAN RATIONING PROTEST

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESI By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 30--Although the great Argentine manhunt that has been in progress for the past four days and that has resulted in arresting many of the most distinguished of the Government's opponents was officially called off at 1 o'clock this...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 30--Although the great Argentine manhunt that has been in progress for the past four days and that has resulted in arresting many of the most distinguished of the Government's opponents was officially called off at 1 o'clock this morning, arrests continued on a smaller scale today.
docs.abstract: Rectors of all but 1 natl univ held; Chile Univ cables sympathy to Buenos Aires Univ
